To perform a task synchronously b. To perform a task asynchronously c. There is nothing like coroutine in kotlin d. all of them 2 can a coroutine contain these keywords a. Deferred b. Async c. await and launch d. all of them 4 when you create
a coroutine

using async, launch

and await

lateinit var mName:String

GlobalScope.launch(Dispatchers.Main) {

mName = getDataFromAPI().await()

textview.setText(mName)

}
a. The above code executes in a sequence and await blocks execution of textview.settext until result is obtained from getDataFromAPI b. The above code executes in a sequence and await does not block the execution of textview.settext until the result is obtained from getDataFromAPI c. Both the cases are correct d. The above code does not compile as there is no such keyword called globalscope 1 what does interoperability mean in kotlin a. Interoperability allows a developer to use both java and kotlin classes in the same project b. Only kotlin programming language is used in entire project c. Interoperable means allowing a class written in java to be called by another class written in kotlin d. this+value

Int.reduceValueConstraint get() =minus(100) c.
